intro: Corynephorus canescens var. minor, commonly known as the lesser silvergrass, is a perennial grass native to the temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, silver-haired leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are often tinged with brown or reddish hues. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grassy areas. Due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
